alert.note: Alert for Sherman (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 7:01PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Kit Carson and northwestern Sherman Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 600 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Burlington, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kanorado. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 5. Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 429 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 183 and 206, and near mile marker 211. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for east central Colorado...and northwestern Kansas.
